meanings.definition: Superlative form of pitch, meaning having the most pitch or tar-like substance.
meanings.sent1: The road was sticky and pitchiest after the fresh tar was laid down.
meanings.sent2: The pitchiest part of the roof was where the leak had been patched.
meanings.sent3: The pitchiest puddle in the parking lot made it hard for anyone to walk without getting stuck.
meanings.sent4: Her hands felt pitchiest after working with the tar all day.
meanings.sent5: The pitchiest smell in the air came from the newly paved road.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of pitch, meaning having the darkest or deepest tone.
meanings.sent1: The singer's voice was the pitchiest in the choir, resonating with depth.
meanings.sent2: The pitchiest notes of the piano piece echoed through the concert hall.
meanings.sent3: The pitchiest sound in the forest at night was the owl's hoot.
meanings.sent4: His words had the pitchiest tone, conveying a sense of seriousness.
meanings.sent5: The pitchiest part of the song was when the bass dropped in.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of pitch, meaning having the highest degree of darkness or blackness.
meanings.sent1: The night sky was pitchiest just before the dawn broke.
meanings.sent2: The pitchiest shadows lurked in the corners of the old haunted house.
meanings.sent3: The pitchiest color in the painting was used to create a sense of mystery.
meanings.sent4: The pitchiest clouds gathered ominously before the storm.
meanings.sent5: The pitchiest part of the forest was where even the moonlight couldn't reach.
